summary: This bill, the NO TIME TO Waste Act, aims to reduce food loss and waste in the United States. It authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture to establish an Office of Food Loss and Waste to conduct research, support grant programs for state and local governments, and launch a public awareness campaign. It also establishes regional coordinators, supports food recovery infrastructure, promotes public-private partnerships, and strengthens interagency collaboration on food waste reduction. The bill amends existing legislation concerning federal contractors and composting programs to further these goals.
